intro: Urera oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often glossy and arranged oppositely along the stems. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. Urera oblongifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
